intro: Coleosanthus californicus, commonly known as the California sedge, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a triangular cross-section characteristic of many sedges. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets, which are clustered along the stem.
